nodes.text: Day 0: ND7/23 cell seeding
Pre-coat eight-well Lab-Tek II chambered coverglasses with 10 µg/ml solution of poly-D-lysine in ddH2O for a minimum of 4 h at RT.
Wash the chambered coverglasses three times with ddH2O and allow to dry under a sterile hood.

cell culturing medium which contains high-glucose Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium (DMEM) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated fetal bovine serum (inactivated by incubation at 56 °C for 30 min), 1% penicillin-streptomycin (PS), 1% sodium pyruvate and 1% L-glutamine.
Seed cells at a density of 25,000 cells per well in 250 µl of ND7/23 cell culturing medium

Culture seeded cells overnight at 37° C, 5% CO2
.
Day 1: ND7/23 cell transfection
Pre-warm Opti-MEM™ I Reduced Serum Medium to 37° C.
Prepare transfection mix with a DNA/Lipofectamine 2000 ratio of 1 µg:2.4 µl
node
Vortex the tubes gently for 10 seconds, then centrifuge briefly to spin down. Incubate 5 min at RT
Add the contents of tube 1 to the tube 2.
Vortex the tube gently for 10 seconds, then centrifuge briefly to spin down. Incubate 20 min at RT
Prepare a 1:4 dilution of TCO*A-Lys in 1 M HEPES. For one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber mix 1.875 µl of 1 M HEPES and 0.625 µl of 100 mM TCO*A-Lys stock solution.
Take the cells out of the incubator. Add 25 µl of the transfection mix dropwise to the culturing medium. Handle up to two Lab-Tek II chambered coverglasses at a time

Add 2.5 µl of TCO*A-Lys dilution in a corner of the well. Move the Lab-Tek II chambered coverglass up and down, left and right to resuspend the TCO*A-Lys. The final concentration of TCO*A-Lys is 250 µM.
Incubate the cells 6 h at 37° C, 5% CO2
Aspirate the transfection mix-containing medium from cells and add 250 µl of warm ND7/23 cell culturing medium.

Add 2.5 µl of TCO*A-Lys dilution in a corner of the well. Move the Lab-Tek II chambered coverglass up
and down, left and right to resuspend the TCO*A-Lys. The final concentration of TCO*A-Lys is 250 µM
Incubate the cells overnight at 37° C, 5% CO2.
Day 2: Bioorthogonal click chemistry labeling with cell-permeable tetrazine dyes in live cells or labeling with cell-impermeable dyes after fixation
Pre-warm the ND7/23 cell culturing medium to 37°C
Remove TCO*A-Lys from cells by aspirating the medium and rinsing 2x with warm cell culturing medium. Add 250 µl of culturing medium per one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber
Incubate 2-3 h at 37° C, 5% CO2
Prepare a 5 µM tetrazine-dye dilution in warm culturing medium.
Aspirate the medium from cells, rinse once more with warm culturing medium and add the tetrazine-dye dilution.
Incubate 10 min at 37° C, 5% CO2
Aspirate the tetrazine-dye dilution from cells, rinse 2x with warm culturing medium, and then add 250µl of culturing medium per one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber
Incubate for 2-3 h at 37° C, 5% CO2

Aspirate the medium from cells, rinse once with phosphate-buffered saline (PBS)and fix for 15 min at RT with 4% paraformaldehyde
(PFA) dissolved in 0.1 M phosphate buffer (PB). Wash the cells 3x5 min with PBS and keep at 4° C until imaging or immunocytochemistry labeling.
Alternatively, if cell-impermeable tetrazine-dyes are to be used for labeling, fix the cells after labeling and washing with 4% PFA diluted in PB for 15 min at RT

Rinse the cells 3x with PBS and permeabilize with 0.1% Triton X-100 diluted in PBS for 10 min at RT. Incubate for 10 min at 37° C with the cell-impermeable tetrazine-dye diluted to the final concentration of 0.5-2.5 µM in PBS.
Aspirate the dye, rinse 3x with PBS and incubate with PBS on a shaker at RT for 20-30 min. Keep at 4° C until immunocytochemistry staining or microscopy.
I. Bioorthogonal click chemistry labeling of proteins in ND7/23 neuroblastoma cells
II. Bioorthogonal click chemistry labeling of proteins in primary neurons
Neuron seeding and transfection
Day 0: Neuron seeding

Pre-coat eight-well Lab-Tek II chambered coverglasses with 20 µg/ml solution of poly-d-lysine in ddH2O for 2 h at RT. Wash the chambered coverglasses three times with ddH2O and allow to dry under a sterile hood.
Pre-incubate coated coverglasses for at least 30 min at 37° C with neuron culturing medium
neuron culturing medium consisting of Neurobasal Plus (NB Plus) medium with the addition of 2% B27 Plus and 1% PS (referred to as NB Plus +).
Thaw primary mouse cortical neurons (MCNs) from C57BL/6 embryonic day 17 and seed them at the density of 90,000-110,000 cells, in 500 µl of medium per well.
Day 3 and day 7: Medium change

Pre-warm the NB Plus + medium at 37° C. Aspirate 200 µl of the medium from each well and add 250 µl of fresh warm NB Plus + medium. When changing the medium on day 7, collect the aspirated medium in tubes and keep at 4° C for further use as conditioned medium (CM).
Day 8: Transfection
Transfect MCNs using Lipofectamine 2000 and a DNA/Lipofectamine 2000 ratio of 1 µg:2.4 µl
Prepare the transfection medium A by adding 1% of PS to Neurobasal Plus medium. Prepare the transfection medium B by adding 1% of PS and 4% of B27 Plus to Neurobasal Plus medium.
Warm up both transfection media to 37° C.
node
Vortex the tubes gently for 10 seconds, then centrifuge briefly to spin down. Incubate 5 min at RT.
Add the contents of tube 1 to the tube 2.
Vortex the tube gently for 10 seconds, then centrifuge briefly to spin down. Incubate 20 min at RT

Add 100 µl of warm transfection medium B to the transfection mix. The final transfection mix will contain 2% of B27 Plus and 1% of PS, the same as the culturing medium. Mix by pipetting and avoid making bubbles. Incubate 5 min at 37° C, 5% CO2
.
Take the neurons from the incubator, aspirate all of the culturing medium from wells and keep for use as a CM. Add 200 µl of the warm transfection mix dropwise

Add transfection mix to a maximum of 4
wells of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chambered coverglass at a time.

Incubate 4-6 h at 37° C, 5% CO2
.

Right before the medium change, prepare a 1:4 dilution of TCO*A-Lys in 1 M HEPES. For one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber mix 3.75 µl of 1 M HEPES and 1.25 µl of 100 mM TCO*A-Lys stock solution.

Right before the medium change, prepare a 1:4 dilution of TCO*A-Lys in 1 M HEPES. For one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber mix 3.75 µl of 1 M HEPES and 1.25 µl of 100 mM TCO*A-Lys stock solution.
Aspirate the transfection mix from neurons and add 500 µl of previously prepared CM with 250 µM of TCO*A-Lys

Incubate for 2-3 days at 37° C, 5% CO2
.
Day 10 or day 11: Single-color bioorthogonal click chemistry labeling of live neurons
Pre-warm the fresh NB Plus + medium and CM to 37°C
Remove TCO*A-Lys from neurons by aspirating the medium and rinsing 2x with warm fresh NB Plus+. Add 125 µl of CM and 125 µl of warm fresh NB Plus + per one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber
Incubate 2-3 h at 37° C, 5% CO2
Aspirate the medium from neurons, rinse once more with warm fresh NB Plus + and add the tetrazine-dye dilution
Incubate 10 min at 37° C, 5% CO2
Aspirate the tetrazine-dye dilution from neurons, rinse 2x with warm fresh NB Plus +, and add 125 µl of CM and 125 µl of warm fresh NB Plus + per one well of an eight-well Lab-Tek II chamber.
Incubate for a minimum of 2 h at 37° C, 5% CO2

Aspirate the medium from neurons and fix for 15 min at RT with 4% electron microscopy grade PFA diluted in PEM buffer (80 mM PIPES, 2 mM MgCl2, 5 mM EGTA, pH 6.8). Wash 3x5 min with PBS and keep at 4° C until imaging or immunocytochemistry labeling
Alternatively, replace the NB Plus + with Hibernate E medium (containing 2% B27 Plus and 1% PS) and image live cells at 37° C for up to 5 h
Dual-color pulse-chase bioorthogonal click chemistry labeling in neurons
Day 10: Labeling the first NFL population with a cell-permeable tetrazine-dye in live neurons
Two days after transfection, label the first population of NFL
After the labeling, incubate neurons in 1:1 mixture of CM and fresh NB Plus + for 2-3 h at 37° C, 5% CO2
Aspirate the medium, rinse once more with warm fresh NB Plus + and add a 1:1 mixture of CM and fresh NB Plus + that contains 250 µM TCO*A-Lys. Incubate for additional 2 days at 37° C, 5% CO2.
Day 12: Labeling the second population of NFL with either cell-permeable tetrazine-dye in live neurons or cell-impermeable dye after fixation
Label the second population of NFL in live neurons
After the labeling, incubate for 2-3h at 37° C, 5% CO2. Fix the cells or proceed to live-cell imaging
Alternatively, fix the cells with 4% PFA diluted in PEM buffer for 15 min at RT and rinse 3x with PBS.
Permeabilize the cells with 0.1% Triton X-100 diluted in PBS for 10 min at RT.
Incubate for 10min at 37° C with the cell-impermeable tetrazine-dye diluted to the final concentration of 0.5-2.5 µM in PBS.

For the second population labeling after fixation, we used cell-impermeable ATTO488-tz. Aspirate the dye, rinse 3x with PBS and incubate with PBS on a shaker at RT for 20-30 min. Keep at 4° C until immunocytochemistry staining or microscopy.

target.text: Permeabilize the cells with 0.1% Triton X-100 diluted in PBS for 10 min at RT.

source.text: Permeabilize the cells with 0.1% Triton X-100 diluted in PBS for 10 min at RT.

target.text: Incubate for 10min at 37° C with the cell-impermeable tetrazine-dye diluted to the final concentration of 0.5-2.5 µM in PBS.

source.text: Incubate for 10min at 37° C with the cell-impermeable tetrazine-dye diluted to the final concentration of 0.5-2.5 µM in PBS.

target.text: For the second population labeling after fixation, we used cell-impermeable ATTO488-tz. Aspirate the dye, rinse 3x with PBS and incubate with PBS on a shaker at RT for 20-30 min. Keep at 4° C until immunocytochemistry staining or microscopy.
